text: DEFINITIONS:
label: BODY

text: SECTION 15195                                                               REPAIR WING HEADQUARTERS, BLDG 706
label: BODY

text: FACILITY NATURAL-GAS PIPING
label: BODY

text: BUCKELY AFB
label: BODY

text: Finished Spaces:  Spaces other than mechanical and electrical equipment rooms, furred spaces,
label: BODY

text: pipe and duct shafts, unheated spaces immediately below roof, spaces above ceilings,
label: BODY

text: unexcavated spaces, crawlspaces, and tunnels.
label: BODY

text: Exposed, Interior Installations:  Exposed to view indoors.  Examples include finished occupied
label: BODY

text: spaces and mechanical equipment rooms.
label: BODY

text: Exposed, Exterior Installations:  Exposed to view outdoors or subject to outdoor ambient
label: BODY

text: temperatures and weather conditions.  Examples include rooftop locations.
label: BODY

text: PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS:
label: BODY

text: Minimum Operating-Pressure Ratings:
label: BODY

text: Piping and Valves:  100 psig (690 kPa) minimum unless otherwise indicated.
label: BODY

text: Natural-Gas System Pressure within Buildings:  More than 0.5 psig (3.45 kPa) but not more
label: BODY

text: than 2 psig (13.8 kPa).
label: BODY

text: Delegated Design:  Design restraints and anchors for natural-gas piping and equipment,
label: BODY

text: including comprehensive engineering analysis by a qualified professional engineer, using
label: BODY

text: performance requirements and design criteria indicated.
label: BODY

text: SUBMITTALS:
label: BODY

text: General:  Submit the following in accordance with SECTION 15050 - BASIC MECHANICAL
label: BODY

text: MATERIALS AND METHODS.
label: BODY

text: Product Data:  For each type of the following:
label: BODY

text: Piping specialties.
label: BODY

text: Corrugated, stainless-steel tubing with associated components.
label: BODY

text: Valves.  Include pressure rating, capacity, settings, and electrical connection data of
label: BODY

text: selected models.
label: BODY

text: Pressure regulators.  Indicate pressure ratings and capacities.
label: BODY

text: Qualification Data:  For qualified professional engineer.
label: BODY

text: Welding certificates.
label: BODY

text: Field quality-control reports.
label: BODY

text: Operation and Maintenance Data:  For motorized gas valves and pressure regulators to include
label: BODY

text: in emergency, operation, and maintenance manuals.
label: BODY

text: QUALITY ASSURANCE:
label: BODY

text: Steel Support Welding Qualifications:  Qualify procedures and personnel according to
label: BODY

text: AWS D1.1/D1.1M.
label: BODY

text: Pipe Welding Qualifications:  Qualify procedures and operators according to ASME Boiler and
label: BODY

text: Pressure Vessel Code.
label: BODY

text: Electrical Components, Devices, and Accessories:  Listed and labeled as defined in NFPA 70,
label: BODY

text: by a qualified testing agency, and marked for intended location and application.
label: BODY

text: DELIVERY, STORAGE, AND HANDLING:
label: BODY

text: Handling Flammable Liquids:  Remove and dispose of liquids from existing natural-gas piping
label: BODY

text: according to requirements of authorities having jurisdiction.
label: BODY

text: Deliver pipes and tubes with factory-applied end caps.  Maintain end caps through shipping,
label: BODY

text: storage, and handling to prevent pipe end damage and to prevent entrance of dirt, debris, and
label: BODY

text: moisture.
label: BODY

text: Store and handle pipes and tubes having factory-applied protective coatings to avoid damaging
label: BODY

text: coating, and protect from direct sunlight.
label: BODY

text: SECTION 15195                                                               REPAIR WING HEADQUARTERS, BLDG 706
label: BODY

text: FACILITY NATURAL-GAS PIPING
label: BODY

text: BUCKLEY AFB
label: HH1

text: Protect stored PE pipes and valves from direct sunlight.
label: BODY

text: PROJECT CONDITIONS:
label: BODY

text: Perform site survey, research public utility records, and verify existing utility locations.
label: BODY

text: Contact utility-locating service for area where Project is located.
label: BODY

text: Interruption of Existing Natural-Gas Service:  Do not interrupt natural-gas service to facilities
label: BODY

text: occupied by Owner or others unless permitted under the following conditions and then only
label: BODY

text: after arranging to provide purging and startup of natural-gas supply according to requirements
label: BODY

text: indicated:
label: BODY

text: Notify Contracting Officer no fewer than two days in advance of proposed interruption of
label: BODY

text: natural-gas service.
label: BODY

text: Do not proceed with interruption of natural-gas service without Contracting Officer
label: BODY

text: written permission.
label: BODY

text: COORDINATION:
label: BODY

text: Coordinate sizes and locations of concrete bases with actual equipment provided.
label: BODY

text: Coordinate requirements for access panels and doors for valves installed concealed behind
label: BODY

text: finished surfaces.  Comply with requirements in DIVISION 8.
label: BODY

text: PART 2 -  PRODUCTS
label: BODY

text: PIPES, TUBES, AND FITTINGS:
label: BODY

text: Steel Pipe:  ASTM A53/A53M, black steel, Schedule 40, Type E or S, Grade B.
label: BODY

text: Wrought-Steel Welding Fittings:  ASTM A234/A234M for butt welding and socket
label: BODY

text: welding.
label: BODY

text: Forged-Steel Flanges and Flanged Fittings:  ASME B16.5, minimum Class 150,
label: BODY

text: including bolts, nuts, and gaskets of the following material group, end connections, and
label: BODY

text: facings:
label: BODY

text: Material Group:  1.1.
label: BODY

text: End Connections:  Butt welding to match pipe.
label: BODY

text: Lapped Face:  Not permitted underground.
label: BODY

text: Gasket Materials:  ASME B16.20, metallic, flat, asbestos free, aluminum o-rings,
label: BODY

text: and spiral-wound metal gaskets.
label: BODY

text: Bolts and Nuts:  ASME B18.2.1, carbon steel aboveground and stainless steel
label: BODY

text: underground.
label: BODY

text: Mechanical Couplings:
label: BODY

text: Manufacturers:  Subject to compliance with requirements, provide products by one
label: BODY

text: of the following:
label: BODY

text: Dresser Piping Specialties; Division of Dresser, Inc.
label: BODY

text: Smith-Blair, Inc.
label: BODY

text: Steel flanges and tube with epoxy finish.
label: BODY

text: Buna-nitrile seals.
label: BODY

text: Steel bolts, washers, and nuts.
label: BODY

text: Coupling shall be capable of joining PE pipe to PE pipe, steel pipe to PE pipe, or
label: BODY

text: steel pipe to steel pipe.
label: BODY

text: Steel body couplings installed underground on plastic pipe shall be factory equipped
label: BODY

text: with anode.
label: BODY

text: Corrugated stainless-steel tubing with polymer coating.
label: BODY

text: Operating-Pressure Rating:  0.5 psig (3.45 kPa).
label: BODY

text: End Fittings:  Zinc-coated steel.
label: BODY

text: Maximum Length:  72 inches (1830 mm).
label: BODY

text: Y-Pattern Strainers:
label: BODY

text: Body:  ASTM A126, Class B, cast iron with bolted cover and bottom drain connection.
label: BODY

text: End Connections:  Threaded ends for NPS 2 (DN 50) and smaller; flanged ends for
label: BODY

text: NPS 2-1/2 (DN 65) and larger.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: free area.
label: BODY

text: CWP Rating:  125 psig (862 kPa).
label: BODY

text: Weatherproof Vent Cap:  Cast- or malleable-iron increaser fitting with corrosion-resistant wire
label: BODY

text: screen, with free area at least equal to cross-sectional area of connecting pipe and threaded-end
label: BODY

text: connection.
label: BODY

text: JOINING MATERIALS:
label: BODY

text: Joint Compound and Tape:  Suitable for natural gas.
label: BODY

text: Welding Filler Metals:  Comply with AWS D10.12/D10.12M for welding materials
label: BODY

text: appropriate for wall thickness and chemical analysis of steel pipe being welded.
label: BODY

text: CWP Rating:  125 psig (862 kPa).

label: BODY

text: Shutoff Valve Schedule" and "Aboveground Manual Gas Shutoff Valve Schedule"
label: BODY

text: Articles.
label: BODY

text: Listing:  Listed and labeled by an NRTL acceptable to authorities having jurisdiction for
label: BODY

text: valves 1 inch (25 mm) and smaller.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: CWP Rating:  125 psig (862 kPa).
label: BODY

text: Flanged Ends:  Comply with ASME B16.5 for steel flanges.

text: Tamperproof Feature:  Locking feature for valves indicated in "Underground Manual Gas

label: BODY

text: Articles.

text: Service Mark:  Initials "WOG" shall be permanently marked on valve body.

text: PART 3 -  EXECUTION
label: BODY

text: EXAMINATION:
label: BODY

text: Examine roughing-in for natural-gas piping system to verify actual locations of piping
label: BODY

text: connections before equipment installation.
label: BODY

text: Proceed with installation only after unsatisfactory conditions have been corrected.
label: BODY

text: PREPARATION:
label: BODY

text: Close equipment shutoff valves before turning off natural gas to premises or piping section.
label: BODY

text: Inspect natural-gas piping according to NFPA 54 and the International Fuel Gas Code to
label: BODY

text: determine that natural-gas utilization devices are turned off in piping section affected.
label: BODY

text: Comply with NFPA 54 and the International Fuel Gas Code requirements for prevention of
label: BODY

text: accidental ignition.
label: BODY

text: INDOOR PIPING INSTALLATION:
label: BODY

text: Comply with NFPA 54 and the International Fuel Gas Code for installation and purging of
label: BODY

text: natural-gas piping.
label: BODY

text: Drawing plans, schematics, and diagrams indicate general location and arrangement of piping
label: BODY

text: systems.  Indicated locations and arrangements are used to size pipe and calculate friction loss,
label: BODY

text: expansion, and other design considerations.  Install piping as indicated unless deviations to
label: BODY

text: layout are approved on Coordination Drawings.
label: BODY

text: Arrange for pipe spaces, chases, slots, sleeves, and openings in building structure during
label: BODY

text: progress of construction, to allow for mechanical installations.
label: BODY

text: Install piping in concealed locations unless otherwise indicated and except in equipment rooms
label: BODY

text: and service areas.
label: BODY

text: Install piping indicated to be exposed and piping in equipment rooms and service areas at right
label: BODY

text: angles or parallel to building walls.  Diagonal runs are prohibited unless specifically indicated
label: BODY

text: otherwise.
label: BODY

text: Install piping above accessible ceilings to allow sufficient space for ceiling panel removal.
label: BODY

text: Locate valves for easy access.
label: BODY

text: Install natural-gas piping at uniform grade of 2 percent down toward drip and sediment traps.
label: BODY

text: Install piping free of sags and bends.
label: BODY

text: Install fittings for changes in direction and branch connections.
label: BODY

text: Fire-Barrier Penetrations:  Maintain indicated fire rating of walls, partitions, ceilings, and
label: BODY

text: floors at pipe penetrations.  Seal pipe penetrations with firestop materials.  Comply with
label: BODY

text: requirements in DIVISION 7.
label: BODY

text: Verify final equipment locations for roughing-in.
label: BODY

text: M. Comply with requirements in Sections specifying gas-fired appliances and equipment for
label: BODY

text: roughing-in requirements.
label: BODY

text: Drips and Sediment Traps:  Install drips at points where condensate may collect, including
label: BODY

text: service-meter outlets.  Locate where accessible to permit cleaning and emptying.  Do not
label: BODY

text: install where condensate is subject to freezing.
label: BODY

text: Construct drips and sediment traps using tee fitting with bottom outlet plugged or capped.
label: BODY

text: Use nipple a minimum length of 3 pipe diameters, but not less than 3 inches (75 mm)
label: BODY

text: SECTION 15195                                                               REPAIR WING HEADQUARTERS, BLDG 706
label: BODY

text: FACILITY NATURAL-GAS PIPING
label: BODY

text: BUCKELY AFB
label: BODY

text: long and same size as connected pipe.  Install with space below bottom of drip to remove
label: BODY

text: plug or cap.
label: BODY

text: Extend relief vent connections for service regulators, line regulators, and overpressure
label: BODY

text: protection devices to outdoors and terminate with weatherproof vent cap.
label: BODY

text: Conceal pipe installations in walls, pipe spaces, utility spaces, above ceilings, below grade or
label: BODY

text: floors, and in floor channels unless indicated to be exposed to view.
label: BODY

text: Concealed Location Installations:  Except as specified below, install concealed natural-gas
label: BODY

text: piping and piping installed under the building in containment conduit constructed of steel pipe
label: BODY

text: with welded joints as described in Part 2.  Install a vent pipe from containment conduit to
label: BODY

text: outdoors and terminate with weatherproof vent cap.
label: BODY

text: Above Accessible Ceilings:  Natural-gas piping, fittings, valves, and regulators may be
label: BODY

text: installed in accessible spaces without containment conduit.
label: BODY

text: In Walls or Partitions:  Protect tubing installed inside partitions or hollow walls from
label: BODY

text: physical damage using steel striker barriers at rigid supports.
label: BODY

text: Exception:  Tubing passing through partitions or walls does not require striker
label: BODY

text: barriers.
label: BODY

text: Prohibited Locations:
label: BODY

text: Do not install natural-gas piping in or through circulating air ducts, clothes or trash
label: BODY

text: chutes, chimneys or gas vents (flues), ventilating ducts, or dumbwaiter or elevator
label: BODY

text: shafts.
label: BODY

text: Do not install natural-gas piping in solid walls or partitions.
label: BODY

text: Use eccentric reducer fittings to make reductions in pipe sizes.  Install fittings with level side
label: BODY

text: down.
label: BODY

text: Connect branch piping from top or side of horizontal piping.
label: BODY

text: Install unions in pipes NPS 2 (DN 50) and smaller, adjacent to each valve, at final connection
label: BODY

text: to each piece of equipment.  Unions are not required at flanged connections.
label: BODY

text: Do not use natural-gas piping as grounding electrode.
label: BODY

text: Install strainer on inlet of each line-pressure regulator and automatic or electrically operated
label: BODY

text: valve.
label: BODY

text: W. Install pressure gauge upstream and downstream from each line regulator.  Pressure gauges are
label: BODY

text: specified in SECTION 15122 - METERS AND GAUGES.
label: BODY

text: VALVE INSTALLATION:
label: BODY

text: Install manual gas shutoff valve for each gas appliance ahead of corrugated stainless-steel
label: BODY

text: tubing, aluminum, or copper connector.
label: BODY

text: Install regulators and overpressure protection devices with maintenance access space adequate
label: BODY

text: for servicing and testing.
label: BODY

text: PIPING JOINT CONSTRUCTION:
label: BODY

text: Ream ends of pipes and tubes and remove burrs.
label: BODY

text: Remove scale, slag, dirt, and debris from inside and outside of pipe and fittings before
label: BODY

text: assembly.
label: BODY

text: Threaded Joints:
label: BODY

text: Thread pipe with tapered pipe threads complying with ASME B1.20.1.
label: BODY

text: Cut threads full and clean using sharp dies.
label: BODY

text: Ream threaded pipe ends to remove burrs and restore full inside diameter of pipe.
label: BODY

text: Apply appropriate tape or thread compound to external pipe threads unless dryseal
label: BODY

text: threading is specified.
label: BODY

text: SECTION 15195                                                               REPAIR WING HEADQUARTERS, BLDG 706
label: BODY

text: FACILITY NATURAL-GAS PIPING
label: BODY

text: BUCKLEY AFB
label: HH1

text: Damaged Threads:  Do not use pipe or pipe fittings with threads that are corroded or
label: BODY

text: damaged.  Do not use pipe sections that have cracked or open welds.
label: BODY

text: Welded Joints:
label: BODY

text: Construct joints according to AWS D10.12/D10.12M, using qualified processes and
label: BODY

text: welding operators.
label: BODY

text: Bevel plain ends of steel pipe.
label: BODY

text: Patch factory-applied protective coating as recommended by manufacturer at field welds
label: BODY

text: and where damage to coating occurs during construction.
label: BODY

text: HANGER AND SUPPORT INSTALLATION:
label: BODY

text: Install seismic restraints on piping.  Comply with requirements for seismic-restraint devices
label: BODY

text: specified in SECTION 15071 - MECHANICAL VIBRATION AND SEISMIC CONTROLS.
label: BODY

text: Comply with requirements for pipe hangers and supports specified in SECTION 15060 -
label: BODY

text: HANGERS AND SUPPORTS
label: BODY

text: Install hangers for horizontal steel piping with the following maximum spacing and minimum
label: BODY

text: rod sizes:
label: BODY

text: NPS 1 (DN 25) and Smaller:  Maximum span, 96 inches (2438 mm); minimum rod size,
label: BODY

text: NPS 1-1/4 (DN 32):  Maximum span, 108 inches (2743 mm); minimum rod size, 3/8-inch
label: BODY

text: NPS 1-1/2 and NPS 2 (DN 40 and DN 50):  Maximum span, 108 inches (2743 mm);
label: BODY

text: minimum rod size, 3/8-inch (10-mm).
label: BODY

text: NPS 2-1/2 to NPS 3-1/2 (DN 65 to DN 90):  Maximum span, 10 feet (3 m); minimum rod
label: BODY

text: size, 1/2-inch (13-mm).
label: BODY

text: CONNECTIONS:
label: BODY

text: Connect to utility's gas main according to utility's procedures and requirements.
label: BODY

text: Install natural-gas piping electrically continuous, and bonded to gas appliance equipment
label: BODY

text: grounding conductor of the circuit powering the appliance according to NFPA 70.
label: BODY

text: Install piping adjacent to appliances to allow service and maintenance of appliances.
label: BODY

text: Connect piping to appliances using manual gas shutoff valves and unions.  Install valve within
label: BODY

text: 72 inches (1800 mm) of each gas-fired appliance and equipment.  Install union between valve
label: BODY

text: and appliances or equipment.
label: BODY

text: Sediment Traps:  Install tee fitting with capped nipple in bottom to form drip, as close as
label: BODY

text: practical to inlet of each appliance.
label: BODY

text: LABELING AND IDENTIFYING:
label: BODY

text: Comply with requirements in SECTION 15075 - MECHANICAL IDENTIFICATION for
label: BODY

text: piping and valve identification.
label: BODY

text: Install detectable warning tape directly above gas piping, 12 inches (300 mm) below finished
label: BODY

text: grade, except 6 inches (150 mm) below subgrade under pavements and slabs.
label: BODY

text: PAINTING:
label: BODY

text: Comply with requirements in DIVISION 9 for painting interior and exterior natural-gas piping.
label: BODY

text: Paint exposed, exterior metal piping, valves, service regulators, service meters and meter bars,
label: BODY

text: earthquake valves, and piping specialties, except components, with factory-applied paint or
label: BODY

text: protective coating.
label: BODY

text: Alkyd System:  MPI EXT 5.1D.
label: BODY

text: SECTION 15195                                                               REPAIR WING HEADQUARTERS, BLDG 706
label: BODY

text: FACILITY NATURAL-GAS PIPING
label: BODY

text: BUCKELY AFB
label: BODY

text: Prime Coat:  Alkyd anticorrosive metal primer.
label: BODY

text: Intermediate Coat:  Exterior alkyd enamel matching topcoat.
label: BODY

text: Topcoat:  Exterior alkyd enamel (flat).
label: BODY

text: Color:  Gray.
label: BODY

text: Damage and Touchup:  Repair marred and damaged factory-applied finishes with materials
label: BODY

text: and by procedures to match original factory finish.
label: BODY

text: FIELD QUALITY CONTROL:
label: BODY

text: Perform tests and inspections.
label: BODY

text: Tests and Inspections:
label: BODY

text: Test, inspect, and purge natural gas according to NFPA 54 and the International Fuel Gas
label: BODY

text: Code and authorities having jurisdiction.
label: BODY

text: Natural-gas piping will be considered defective if it does not pass tests and inspections.
label: BODY

text: Prepare test and inspection reports.
label: BODY

text: DEMONSTRATION:
label: BODY

text: Engage a factory-authorized service representative to train Owner's maintenance personnel to
label: BODY

text: adjust, operate, and maintain earthquake valves.
label: BODY

text: INDOOR PIPING SCHEDULE FOR SYSTEM PRESSURES MORE THAN 0.5 PSIG (3.45
label: BODY

text: KPA) AND LESS THAN 5 PSIG (34.5 KPA):
label: BODY

text: Aboveground, branch piping NPS 2 (DN 50) and smaller shall be the following:
label: BODY

text: Steel pipe with malleable-iron fittings and threaded joints.
label: BODY

text: Aboveground, distribution piping shall be the following:
label: BODY

text: Steel pipe with malleable-iron fittings and threaded joints.
label: BODY

text: ABOVEGROUND MANUAL GAS SHUTOFF VALVE SCHEDULE:
label: BODY

text: Valves for pipe sizes NPS 2 (DN 50) and smaller at service meter shall be one of the
label: BODY

text: following:
label: BODY

text: One-piece, bronze ball valve with bronze trim.
label: BODY

text: Bronze plug valve.
label: BODY

text: Valves in branch piping for single appliance shall be one of the following:
label: BODY

text: One-piece, bronze ball valve with bronze trim.
label: BODY

text: Bronze plug valve.
label: BODY

text: END OF SECTION 15195
